texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Oh, for the love of God!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Ugh...
It's been a few days since Olivia started helping out at the pub.
Preparation, then rehearsal, then running the pub, and then revising the script has become my daily routine.
But I still can't see the light at the end of the tunnel when it comes to performing.
These last few days, it's become clear to me that a script is nothing but a blueprint for what we call good theater.
As things stand, the prospects of the Spencer troupe prevailing against the Admiral's Men are slim to say the least.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Do you understand? Hermia has stood against her father for the first time. This naive, noble maiden has left her house to spend the night in the woods to be together with her beloved!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: She spends the night fretting over whether he'll hold her in his arms and return her love! She has never felt this strongly in her whole life! And at dawn, this man tells her that he loves another woman!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Now, deliver her line! With feeling!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: H-Help me, Lysander, help me! Ay me, for pity! What a dream was here! Look how I do quake with fear!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Bloody hell! Why are you such a lousy actor?! Didn't you write this yourself?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah, but...
Did I really, though?
I can't even tell anymore.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I call a break! We're getting nowhere fast with this! Will, you keep practicing!
Olivia slams the script on the desk and stomps into the wings.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: The leader is more intense than usual these days, eh?

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: I told you so. She's gotten like this because you actually write good stuff.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: You're reaping what you sow, in a sense.
Kiki and Thomas get a laugh out of my helplessness.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Not that I mind. She's too busy with you to get on our arses now.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: You can say that again.
I understand Olivia's impatience.
We only have a few days before we have to actually present a play to the public.
By then, we have to raise the quality of our acting from child's play to something able to compete with the Admiral's Men.
Now, therein lies the problem. How to achieve that?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Well, you should have started by not picking a fight with Marlowe.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Perhaps, yeah.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Not like there's any need to beat him or anything. As long as this troupe has Spencer's patronage, it'll all be jolly good for us.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yeah, yeah. No chip off your shoulder.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Kiki.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yes?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You're a guy, aren't you? How did you become so good at female mannerisms?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Oh, I'm just doing imitations, that's all.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Yep! I had two twin sisters, you see. I'm just copying them. Their gestures, personality, and all that.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Well, we were all alike personality-wise to begin with, so I suppose that helps.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Twins, huh?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Didn't you imagine people you knew when you wrote this script? Like past lovers or something?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Uh, not really?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Huh? It all came from your own imagination?!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: When it comes to the female characters, yeah.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: That's impressive!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Wait, no woman has ever inspired you?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Uh, when it comes to the lovers thing, no. I haven't had one.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: So when the boss said you needed to get shagged, she really meant it?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Well, it's not like I don't want to, it's just never happened. I mean, it's not that I don't know how to deal with women or, err...

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Ahahah!

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: But you're such a pretty boy! What a waste!

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Go visit a brothel, they'll love you!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Err, I wouldn't want my first time to be like that...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Yeah, that's not for me. Isn't it better for your first time to be with someone you love? Isn't that right?

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Whoa, we got one serious case here...

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Impressive how you can write plays like these while being such a prude.

texts.name: Kiki
texts.text: Well, it's just an observation. Just try to show some interest in girls, would you? You'll learn a lot from actually speaking with them.

texts.name: Thomas
texts.text: Yeah, start from there and work your way up. No need to be such a sad sap.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Show some interest, huh?
After that, Olivia raked me over the coals, but practice ended without me showing much improvement.
Everyone has already memorized their lines.
I've got the motions internalized.
But what I can't seem to find in me is the emotion needed to deliver the lines convincingly.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You look like a dog being dragged to a slaughterhouse. It's like you're being forced to stand on the bloody stage.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Well...
Yeah, because I am!
Immediately after opening, two of Olivia's regulars show up, have a few drinks, and leave.
After that business slows down a fair bit, and Olivia sits at the counter.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Above all, I'm certain you have no female figure in your mind. That's why you feel unnatural, because you're delivering lines without any inspiration to draw from.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Go bed a woman and get that broomstick out of your arse, would you?

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Ahahah! You're getting told, eh?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: This is no laughing matter, old man! Your bloodline's gonna end with him at this rate!

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Not like it matters especially. We never had much pedigree to begin with.
Olivia sighs in exasperation and looks up at me.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Say, have you ever had something you wanted more than anything else? Something you really desired to obtain?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...Deer?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Then you wouldn't have gotten cold feet when you tried to get one.
She's got me there.
I ponder upon her question seriously.
But I'm unable to find an answer.
I have a good memory. I never forget a thing.
So the fact that I can't find the answer means...
That I have no such thing.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It doesn't have to be a woman. A desire to best Marlowe would more than suffice.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Is there a conviction in your heart that you wouldn't ever back down from?

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Son, I want to drink ale. I feel a conviction in my heart, and I won't allow anyone to stop me.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Be quiet, would you?
Just then, the door to the pub slams open.
Rob, eyes bloodshot and shoulders heaving, stands in the entrance.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: What is it? A customer?
Even without sight, my dad can sense that something is amiss.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: You're late today.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Rob? What's wrong?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: It's Ed...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: What is it? Out with it, man!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: He's not with you today?

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: The watchmen caught him.
No sooner has Rob explained the situation than I dash out of the pub.
Will I be able to change anything if I'm there?
Before I can even form a coherent thought, I'm running through the streets.
There's no time for thinking, it's just a crazed dash.
The darkness spreads around me.
Eventually, I come upon a dimly lit street and a crowd of people gathered around something.
There's a carriage in front of the crowd.
In the middle of the crowd, I spot Ed.
My heart jumps at the scene I witness.
Ed has his hands tied behind his back and is being led away by members of the city watch.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: No, you can't!
Just as I'm about to start pushing my way through the crowd to get to Ed...
Someone grabs hold of my hand.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Don't.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Get your hands off me!

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Calm down.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: What will happen to your father if you cause a scene here?
Olivia pulls me in and whispers into my ear.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Rein yourself in. Think very hard about what you're going to do right now.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: No more acting on rash impulses. I beg you.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But Ed... He's gonna...
Ed is forced into the back of the cart.
He looks over the crowd, and our eyes meet.
He looks straight at me.
Then he gives me a small, almost imperceptible nod.
My body feels like a bag of lead.
Anger makes my whole being tremble to the core.
I bite down on my lower lip and warm, coppery blood fills my mouth.
Olivia holds my shivering fist firmly in her hands.
The watchmen board the cart and the horses begin to pull it away.
With Ed on board.
The cart trundles on, exposing Ed to all as a criminal on his way to the gallows.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Ed... He...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: They're taking him... Ed!
My voice trails off as tears begin rolling down my face.
Salty tears mingle with the blood on my lower lip.
Olivia holds my fist tightly.
Ed looks up at the sky, offering a prayer.
His tendons will be turn torn, his intestines pulled out, and his head removed from his body.
While an indolent audience does nothing but watch.
He'll become just another victim of the crazed nonsense sweeping this nation.
Thanks for the help, Marlowe.
Among the bustle of the crowd, a whisper reaches my ear.
A murmur in the wind.
It's coming from behind.
I turn back to see a watchman talking to none other than Marlowe.
He's wearing that same disgusting smirk he had when we spoke in front of the Lily Theater.
And all the credit goes to me, thanks to your good offices.
You know you always have a friend in me, my good man. I'm only happy to do my duty.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You sold him out...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You sold him out!
This time, I manage to shake Olivia off.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Will!
Olivia shouts behind me.
By now, Marlowe has noticed me.
He just has time to bulge his eyes out in surprise before I get a hold of his stupid frilly lapel.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: You bloody cur!

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: What? Ugh—
I slam my fist right into his smug face before he can finish a sentence.
He unceremoniously falls to his backside and directs a venomous gaze up to me as he wipes blood off his lip.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: Shakespeare, huh?
As I'm about to punch him again, a watchman restrains me.
Before I know what's happening, my hands have been restrained behind my back.
Two watchmen are shouting something.
But I'm not capable of comprehending the words coming out of anyone's mouth.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I won't ever forgive you for this.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: You're a lost cause, truly. Didn't we agree to fight this out on stage?

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: Or did I perhaps do something to slight you?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'll choke the life out of you. I swear.

texts.name: Marlowe
texts.text: Talk some sense, man.
The watchman who was talking to Marlowe moves in front of me and hits me across the face.
My vision blurs for a moment, but I don't feel the pain.
I'm struck twice, thrice.
Behind the short, stout man, I see Marlowe get to his feet.
He glances at the beating I'm getting, then turns around and disappears into the night.
I can no longer hear the sound of the cart carrying Ed.
Ed...
In the end, I couldn't give you anything back.
Despite all the peace of mind and support you always gave me, I never gave a damn bloody thing in return.
Gradually, the dull sound echoing in my skull fades into the distance.
Ed, next time we meet...
If we're born again...
I hope next time we can talk more. Without fear, just a good talk over good ale.
Ed...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Ugh...
When I wake up, I feel like my face is on fire.
Every part of it hurts like hell.
What in the world happened?
My lips are especially painful.
They're swelling something fierce.
When I try to get up, my whole body aches in staunch protest.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Huh?
At the same time as I raise my upper body, a slap brings unspeakable pain to my right cheek.
The shock brings back all the memories from before I passed out.
Ed got caught by the Queen's men.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Ah, you're finally awake.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Sadly...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: One wrong step, and you'd be behind bars right now.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And not just you. Everyone here would have gotten thrown in jail.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: And I'm not even a Catholic!

texts.name: Will
texts.text: So you know...

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Who wouldn't after such a foolish display? I thought this pub was important to you?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Isn't this your home?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Why do you risk losing it all with these emotional outbursts? You're not a bloody child.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: ...I'm sorry.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: I'm not the one you should be apologizing to, now am I?
Olivia's imposing glare turns to Rob and my dad, who are watching from a distance.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'm sorry. They took Ed right in front of me...
I squeeze out the words, choking on a sob.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I just saw red when I saw him all tied up. It happened again... I didn't think about what would happen to Rob or you, Dad. I just...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I'm sorry.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: You hit a noble who happened to be there?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Not a noble, but the playwright of the Admiral's Men. Christopher Marlowe.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Oh no, Son...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Ed worked at the Lily Theater. That's where they're based.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Right, that theater.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I overheard a watchman thanking Marlowe.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: He spoke of the credit he'd get being thanks to Marlowe.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Ed was sold out.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: By Christopher Marlowe.

texts.name: Father
texts.text: Are you certain?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It's true that rumors of being an informant for the Crown surround Marlowe.
Everyone turns to Olivia.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Talk among the nobles points to him being a spy under the Queen's command.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: It is also well known that whenever Marlowe and his entourage have been detained for crimes, they have been let out without charges being pressed.

texts.name: Rob
texts.text: Then it must be true.
I look down at the back of my right hand.
My knuckles are red and swollen.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I could only punch him once...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: But it's not enough. For what he's done...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: One punch is nowhere near enough.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Are you dumber than a headless chicken? If you insist on assaulting people—
I shake my head.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I won't use my fists to strike him down anymore. What I will use is...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: My quill.
I raise my face.
Olivia looks down at me.
Her expression nonchalant, but her eyes piercing into my very soul.
I return that gaze with mind.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: My quill and my words.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I will crush him soundly. By God's blood, I swear it.
Tears still flow liberally from my eyes.
But I'm past caring for appearances.
Olivia's gaze remains steady, unblinking.
I feel the certainty that my determination reacher her.
I feel how our hearts resonate.
The fire of determination and ambition, tempered by pain.
I feel a surge of fire well up from deep within me.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I will become a playwright to surpass him. This I swear.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Great enough to erase that piece of rubbish from history.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I will end him.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I don't care if all I do is female roles. Please teach me.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I can't keep going the way I am. The other troupe members also need training enough so they don't lose to the Admiral's Men. Can you do it?

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Finally, you're speaking sense.

texts.name: Will
texts.text: Olivia, please...

texts.name: Will
texts.text: I beg you, drum the soul of theater into me.
And I see Olivia's eyes set alight, like flames in the dark.
An inferno burns behind those blazing rose eyes.
It draws me in, like a moth to the flame.

texts.name: Olivia
texts.text: Now, that's the fire I wanted to see.
